text: We're seeing a clear pattern in our user research: people don't want more features, they want fewer features that actually work well. Simplicity wins.
After interviewing 50 PMs this year, the #1 skill that separates great from good: ruthless prioritization. Everyone says yes to too much.
Unpopular opinion: most startups fail not because of tech debt, but because they build features nobody asked for. Talk to users weekly or die.
Just shipped a feature that reduced our API latency by 40%. Key insight: batch your database calls, even if it feels awkward at first.
Thread on what I learned scaling from 0 to 1M users: 1/ Your database will be fine longer than you think. Don't prematurely optimize.
